form.longName: PhenX PX730401 - Passive Exposures To Tobacco Products
form.preferredDefinition: This protocol includes the National Adult Tobacco Survey (NATS) and the Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health (PATH) Survey. Collectively, the questions are used to assess a respondent's exposure to smoke in different environments.

question.questionText: Not counting decks, porches, or garages, during the past 7 days, that is, since last [TODAY'S DAY OF WEEK], on how many days did someone other than you smoke tobacco inside your home while you were at home? (days_someone_smoke_inside_homedays)

Not counting decks, porches, or garages, during the past 7 days, that is, since last [TODAY'S DAY OF WEEK], on how many days did someone other than you smoke tobacco inside your home while you were at home? (days_someone_smoke_inside_home)
Not counting decks, porches, or garages, inside your home, is smoking ____________? (inside_home_smoking_is)

validValue.meaningText: Allowed only at some times or in some places
validValue.description: Allowed only at some times or in some places

question.questionText: Not counting decks, porches, or garages, to your knowledge, during the past 7 days, that is, since last [TODAY'S DAY OF WEEK], has anyone, including yourself, smoked tobacco inside your home when he or she was not supposed to? (past7days_anyone_smoked_tobacco_insidenotsupposeto)
Do you currently have one job or more than one job? (currently_have_oneormore_job)
Most of the time, do you work __________? (most_of_time_doyou_work)

validValue.meaningText: Indoors in a place like an office building, retail store, restaurant or factory
validValue.description: Indoors in a place like an office building, retail store, restaurant or factory

question.questionText: At your workplace, is smoking in indoor areas __________? (workplace_smoking_indoor_areas)

validValue.meaningText: Allowed only at some times or in some places
validValue.description: Allowed only at some times or in some places

question.questionText: At your workplace, is smoking in outdoor areas ________? (workplace_smoking_outdorr_areas)

validValue.meaningText: Allowed only at some times or in some places
validValue.description: Allowed only at some times or in some places

question.questionText: At your workplace, is the use of chewing tobacco, snuff, dip, or snus _______? (workplace_use_chewingtobacco_dip_smokeless)

validValue.meaningText: Allowed only at some times or in some places
validValue.description: Allowed only at some times or in some places

question.questionText: To your knowledge, during the past 30 = days, that is, since [DATE FILL], has anyone, including yourself, used tobacco products of any kind, including electronic cigarettes, at your work when he or she was not supposed to? (pas30days_hasanyone_usedtobacco_work_notsupposeto)
During the past 7 days, that is, since last [TODAY'S DAY OF WEEK], on how many days did you ride in a vehicle where someone other than you was smoking tobacco? (pas7days_ride_vehicle_someonesmoking)

During the past 7 days, that is, since last [TODAY'S DAY OF WEEK], on how many days did you ride in a vehicle where someone other than you was smoking tobacco? (pas7days_ride_vehicle_someonesmoking_days)
Not counting motorcycles, in the vehicles that you or family members who live with you own or lease, is smoking ___________ (notmotorcycles_vehicles_family_smoking_allowed)

validValue.meaningText: Sometimes allowed in at least one vehicle
validValue.description: Sometimes allowed in at least one vehicle

validValue.meaningText: Respondents family does not own or lease a vehicle
validValue.description: Respondents family does not own or lease a vehicle

question.questionText: Not counting times while you were at work, during the past 7 days, that is, since last TODAY'S DAY OF WEEK], on how many days did you breathe the smoke from someone else who was smoking in an indoor or outdoor public place? (notwork_7days_breathesmoke_someelse_smoking)

Not counting times while you were at work, during the past 7 days, that is, since last [TODAY'S DAY OF WEEK], on how many days did you breathe the smoke from someone else who was smoking in an indoor or outdoor public place? (notwork_7days_breathesmoke_someelse_smokingdays)

Not counting times while you were at work, to your knowledge, during the past 7 days, that is, since last [TODAY'S DAY OF WEEK], has anyone, including yourself, used tobacco of any kind in an indoor or outdoor public place when he or she was not supposed to? (notwork_7days_anyonetobacco_notsupposedto)
Secondhand Smoke Exposure Section:The next questions ask about tobacco use at your workplace and your home. (secondhand_730401)
Which best describes your current job or paid employment status? (best_describes_currentjob_status)

validValue.meaningText: Work full-time at least 35 hours per week
validValue.description: Work full-time at least 35 hours per week

validValue.meaningText: Work part-time less than 15 hours per week
validValue.description: Work part-time less than 15 hours per week

validValue.meaningText: I don't currently work for pay
validValue.description: I don't currently work for pay

question.questionText: How recently did someone smoke around you while you were at work? (how_recently_someone_smoke_aroundyouwork)

validValue.meaningText: Longer than a month ago but within the past year
validValue.description: Longer than a month ago but within the past year

question.questionText: In your childhood, did you live with a regular smoker who smoked inside your home?Please think about anyone who smoked cigarettes, cigars, a pipe, or hookah. (your_childhood_livewith_smoker_inside)
The next question asks about the rules of using tobacco inside your home. (rules_730401)
Does anyone who lives with you now do any of the following? Choose all that apply. (anyone_liveswith_younow_dofollowing_chooseallapply)

validValue.meaningText: Use smokeless tobacoo, such as chewing tobacco, snuff, dip, or snus
validValue.description: Use smokeless tobacoo, such as chewing tobacco, snuff, dip, or snus

validValue.meaningText: Smoke cigars, cigarillos, or filtered cigars
validValue.description: Smoke cigars, cigarillos, or filtered cigars

validValue.meaningText: Use any other form of tobacco, including electronic cigarettes
validValue.description: Use any other form of tobacco, including electronic cigarettes

validValue.meaningText: No one who lives with me now uses any form of tobacco
validValue.description: No one who lives with me now uses any form of tobacco

question.questionText: During the past seven days, about how many hours were you around others who were smoking in a car, whether or not you were smoking yourself ? (past7days_hours_around_smoking_car)
During the past seven days, about how many hours were you around others who were smoking at school, whether or not you were smoking yourself ? (past7days_hours_around_smoking_school)
During the past seven days, about how many hours were you around others who were smoking outdoors, whether or not you were smoking yourself? (past7days_hours_around_smoking_outdoors)
During the past seven days, about how many hours were you around others who were smoking, whether or not you were smoking yourself? (past7days_hours_around_smoking_encoded)

protocol.preferredDefinition: This protocol includes the National Adult Tobacco Survey (NATS) and the Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health (PATH) Survey. Collectively, the questions are used to assess a respondent's exposure to smoke in different environments.

form.longName: PhenX PX730501 - Physical Properties Of Tobacco Products Cigarettes And Filtered Cigars
form.preferredDefinition: The 1999 Massachusetts Benchmark Study protocol includes physical methods and tests to evaluate the length, circumference, filter ventilation, tobacco weight, filter composition, and filter overwrap length of cigarettes and filtered cigars. This information is collected directly through visual inspections.

module.longName: Physical Properties of Tobacco Products - Cigarettes and Filtered Cigars
module.preferredDefinition: Physical Properties of Tobacco Products - Cigarettes and Filtered Cigars

question.questionText: Cigarette Length (cig_length_730501)

Ten cigarettes, laid mouth to butt, are placed in a Cerulean cd2 express or Borgwaldt S10. The total length of the ten cigarettes is determined. The average length is calculated by dividing the total length by the number measured (10). Results are measured in millimeters. (ten_cigarettes_total_length_withfilters)

The filters from each cigarette are removed, and the total length of ten filters laid end to end is determined. The average length is calculated by dividing the total length by the number measured (10). Results are measured in millimeters. (ten_cigarettes_total_length_withoutfilters)
Circumference (circumference_730501)

A Cerulean cd2 express or Borgwaldt S10 is used for the circumference determination. Samples consist of 20 cigarettes, with each cigarette being tested individually. The AHL transports individual cigarettes to the testing station. The second module determines cigarette circumference by the linear displacement of a tape gauge that encircles the cigarette. Circumference results are measured to the one hundredth of a millimeter. (cigarette_averageof20_circumference)
Tobacco Weight (tobacco_weight_730501)

Tobacco weight is determined using an indirect method. A group of 15 cigarettes is weighed and the composite weight recorded. The tobacco weight is calculated by difference. The average tobacco weight per cigarette is obtained by dividing the difference by 15. Results are reported in grams. (tobaccoweight_15cigarettes_composite_weighttotal)

The paper and filters of the corresponding 15 cigarettes are then removed and weighed and the composite weight recorded. The tobacco weight is calculated by difference. The average tobacco weight per cigarette is obtained by dividing the difference by 15. Results are reported in grams. (tobaccoweight_15cigarettes_compositweight_papersfiltersonly)
Filter Type (filter_type_730501)

Filter type is determined through visual or chemical techniques. After outer papers are removed, a visual examination is conducted. If a visual determination cannot be made, the sample is placed in acetone or sulfuric acid. Cellulose acetate dissolves in acetone and paper dissolves in sulfuric acid. Only 1 cigarette is required per determination. (filtertype_celluloseacetate_paper_cigarette)
Filter Ventilation (ventilation_730501)

Ventilation is the percentage of total air flow drawn through the sample via the sides of the filter generally entering through perforations in the cigarette tipping paper. The Borgwaldt PV10 is used to perform the measurement. Results represent the average filter tip ventilation of 15 cigarettes and are reported in percent (%). (filterventilation_total_airflow_cigarettecigar)

protocol.longName: Physical Properties of Tobacco Products - Cigarettes and Filtered Cigars
protocol.preferredDefinition: The 1999 Massachusetts Benchmark Study protocol includes physical methods and tests to evaluate the length, circumference, filter ventilation, tobacco weight, filter composition, and filter overwrap length of cigarettes and filtered cigars. This information is collected directly through visual inspections.

form.longName: PhenX PX730701 - Tobacco Brand And Variety Cigars
form.preferredDefinition: Three questions asked by an interviewer to determine the cigar brand and type smoked by respondents.

question.questionText: During the PAST 30 days, what BRAND of CIGAR did you smoke MOST OFTEN? (past30days_brand_cigar_mostoften)

validValue.meaningText: Al Capone (makes regular and little/small cigars)
validValue.description: Al Capone (makes regular and little/small cigars)

validValue.meaningText: Black & Milds (makes regular and cigarillo-medium size cigars) (in Spanish use 'medium size cigars' instead of the word 'cigarillo' here) with plastic hard filters)
validValue.description: Black & Milds (makes regular and cigarillo-medium size cigars) (in Spanish use 'medium size cigars' instead of the word 'cigarillo' here) with plastic hard filters)

validValue.meaningText: King Edward( makes regular and little/small cigars)
validValue.description: King Edward( makes regular and little/small cigars)

validValue.meaningText: Swisher Sweet* (makes regular and little/small cigars)
validValue.description: Swisher Sweet* (makes regular and little/small cigars)

question.questionText: Is that a regular or little cigar? Little cigars are cigarette size with a filter. (regularorlittle_cigar)
During the past 30 days, did you USUALLY smoke flavored cigars? By flavored we mean fruit, candy, alcohol, clove or any other flavorings. (past30days_usually_flavoredcigars_fruitcandyflavor)

protocol.preferredDefinition: Three questions asked by an interviewer to determine the cigar brand and type smoked by respondents.
